required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determination of a Proper Needle Entry Point; Effects of Skin Compression With an Indicator on Radiation Exposure Time of Fluoroscopically Guided Transforaminal Epidural Block in Obese Patients

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the effects of skin compression with an indicator at the needle entry point on radiation exposure time of fluoroscopically guided transforaminal epidural block in obese patients

primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately ≤1 sec after the confirmation of successful epidural injection
primary_outcome.description: Total radiation exposure time during whole epidural procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of the needle readjustments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately ≤1 sec after the confirmation of successful epidural injection
secondary_outcome.description: The number of the needle readjustments for successful epidural injection

clinical_study.condition: Low Back Pain Due to Spinal Nerve Compression

arm_group.description: skin compression with an indicator for determination of needle entry point
non skin compression with an indicator for determination of needle entry point

intervention.description: skin compression with an indicator for determination of needle entry point

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients with ≥ 25 kg/m2 BMI who were scheduled for the transforaminal epidural injection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Local anesthetic allergy, coagulopathy

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Yonsei University College of Medicine
